website_summaries.verdict: Buy the Barista Brain Conical Burr Grinder for its speed and handy built-in scale, but not to play with plenty of grind sizes.
pros: The Barista Brain Conical Burr Grinder produces quality coffee grounds quickly
It also has a built-in scale for extra convenience
Thanks to intuitive controls, It's also simple to use
cons: It costs more and feels less durable than competing burr grinders
It has comparatively fewer grind size settings as well

customer_reviews.title: Hunk of junk - take my sage advice and STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is AWFUL! I would give it less than 1 star if I could. I would prefer to return it because we bought it less than 60 days ago however they will not let me because it is over 30 days. There must be some kind of design flaw as the beans don’t fall from the hopper into the grinder so it runs and runs and runs and no coffee. We have cleaned it no less than 15 times. Save your money and go for the Barratza. Stay away from this hunk of junk unless you like to donate $200 to the internet ether.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely loved this grinder for the first 1 1/2 months I ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this grinder for the first 1 1/2 months I owned it -- it was extremely precise and easy to use. Unfortunately it jammed up and the pieces that keep the upper burr in place were sheared off so it no longer works. Given the high price, I would have expected some higher quality workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Coombs

customer_reviews.title: Does not live up to review
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one based on reviews. We roast and grind our own coffee. Chose this one for the digital scale and supposed to be super clean. Hole does not even line up with the grinder. For $200 what the heck?
customer_reviews.author: Kim R.

customer_reviews.title: Messy but there is a solution
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee grinder with one exception. It does throw coffee and make a mess. They should have made the receiver cup higher so it went over the snout of the grinder. When reading other reviews I discovered the solution is to order a metal Klean Kanteen 16-Ounce Stainless Steel Pint Cup that is taller and contains the grounds. I tried it and no more mess. Best feature of the grinder is the dial that allow you to set # of cups, after grinding just pour in filter.
customer_reviews.author: ChasieB

customer_reviews.title: This broke - doesn't hold up over time
customer_reviews.text: I will admit I've had this a while (a few years) but I feel a well made coffee grinder should last like a really long time! This has broken - something is wrong with the scale or some connections on the scale so it will not grind (it says that nothing is on the scale when the container clearly is). Super annoying - I want to buy a product that stands the test of time, not get cheaply made things that constantly break.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary

customer_reviews.title: I love this grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder! It is accurate and well built. I love all of the features and it is sure to suit any needs you have. I am not sure how well it performs for an espresso grind but anything from french press to pour over, to your normal machine coffee maker this will do the job. The built in scale really works well when paired with the OXO coffee maker or any other brand you may have. You simply turn the dial to however many cups you are making and it does the rest (you may want to add coffee beans first though). Really a top class grinder and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Money

customer_reviews.title: Very good, fairly messy
customer_reviews.text: Grinds well and evenly, very expedient and easy to use. It has a very poor seal between the outlet of the coffee grounds and the cup that catches the grounds so the very light flakey bits will blow out beyond the cup and all around your kitchen countertop. What it does well is grind coffee evenly at a moderate price point and since that’s why I bought it gets +5 Stars. What it does poorly is keep all grounds secure and your counter tidy but since that’s not really why I bought it or what I look for in a coffee grinder it gets only -1 Star.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton Farris

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly the grinder I was looking. I can put a small portion of beans in the hopper and it keeps them fresh (air tight and UV protected). I set the grinder to produce 30 grams of ground coffee for my 500 ml of water. I've tried several different grinds and have settled on the fineness I prefer for a pour over. It has only 16 grind settings, but I'm not producing espresso and my tastes are nowhere near refined enough to quibble over the level of control I have with it. A pour over with a mild bean tastes better at 8 than it does at 7.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the mess it creates
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is unbelievably messy to use. The open container and gap between the spout and the container means the grounds actually fly up and out of the container as you grind or get trapped in the spout - I lost 10-20% of the beans I ground. Furthermore, this 10-20% that I lost just got scattered everywhere in my kitchen. The only reason it gets two stars is that it is quiet to operate. But there are a bunch of other grinders out there that are also quiet and don't require the hassle of wiping coffee grounds off of every surface in your kitchen after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H. Raskind

customer_reviews.title: the plastic container creates a static- like velcro so the beans stick to the inside and ...
customer_reviews.text: For as simple as this should have been, it was not. I spent about an hour playing with it. It would calibrate to "0" but then I still couldn't get the digital dial to ready anything other than two dotted lines indicating a bean issue!!! Cumbersome and awkward to take apart to check if beans where stuck . And once I did get it to grind ( not via grams or cups only manually, the plastic container creates a static- like velcro so the beans stick to the inside and outside of it. All in all, for $200 it was a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Saxton

customer_reviews.title: Surprising difficulty for an Oxo product.
customer_reviews.text: Oxo has always been a favorite brand, so purchasing a high end coffee grinder was not a difficult decision. However, soon after purchase, the beans would get stuck in the grinder making the grinder unable to function, and they would have to be manually extracted. Several months later, I cannot even dial in the number of cups I want to grind -- the counter begins blinking "--" rather than cup number, reminiscent of the flashing "12:00" with old VCR players, making it impossible to grind beans under any circumstance.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Loring

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased so far. I've used cheap grinders before (and still use one at work). Grounds everywhere, slow, noisy, imprecise (like those that use timers to "measure" how much they grind). This device has an elegant look - insofar as a high tech grinder can be elegant. It's noisy, but not alarmingly so. It grinds fast, and grinds consistently, and being able to measure out to the gram is wonderful. Highly recommended. For the quality at this price, there is no competition.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Theodoropoulos

customer_reviews.title: Good grind but makes uncontrollable mess and ultimate stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Makes too much of a mess for a grinder in this price range. The dial stopped working all together and it just displays “0” on the display. It is now effectively rendered inoperable.
customer_reviews.author: Genu

customer_reviews.title: Hot Mess
customer_reviews.text: This is machine is absolutely horribly MESSY! It spews fine coffee grinds all over your kitchen. I will edge my bets to figure out the right amount of grounds to make a cup of java any day vs cleaning up this fussy grinders droppings. Trust me just because something costs more or can weigh your grounds - you won’t love it enough to clean up after it ever single day. I already have a 4 year old and husband to look after. This sucks. I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: alison sanderson

customer_reviews.title: on ho, another oxo tool with black power cord :)
customer_reviews.text: i dont know what's the fuss with all the negative reviews. yes, it occasionally spits a morsel of coffee but so what. i am giving it 5 stars for it is a great grinder, takes little space on the kitchen countertop, combines two tools into one and is aesthetically pleasing to the eye. oxo team, job well done! 3 years later update: still 5 stars in my book. it is a great grinder and we have had no problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: I. Ned

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee grinder I've used.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder doesn't leave a mess on my counter which is the primary reason I wanted a different one. It's very easy to use and after doing some math (10.6g per 6oz of water) I was able to make the best cup of coffee everytime. Highly recommend this product. You get what you pay for and this grinder is worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph B.

customer_reviews.title: Not at all intuitive to use. You can have it back.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly written instructions make it difficult to get started. The fact that the unit had been used before turned me off. I absolutely do not believe the fairy tale about QC testing. Having old coffee grounds in the machine (and box) made me do the cleanup they should have done. Instead of enjoying the smell of freshly ground coffee, the machine emits an odor like a defective electrical motor. I am returning this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K

customer_reviews.title: Lousy product
customer_reviews.text: I would give it less than one star if I could. It stopped working 3 months after purchase and 6 weeks after the Amazon return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: CTcitizen

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder ever
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best coffee grinder I have ever used! My last grinder was a burr, but not the conical with gear reduction. There is no static with coffee going everywhere and the coffee has a much smoother taste. Once you set it up (about 5 min) just dial the number of cups. Takes a little trial and error for exact amount, but just scoop out what you need until then. The coffee taste is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: dancer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grinder
customer_reviews.text: The Oxo Grinder earns 5 stars. The grind is a very consistent size. The automatic scale works well for me. Cleanup is straightforward. I've used a Baratza on a daily basis for a few years and, in comparison, the Oxo produces a better grind, and is less work to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: sparkyr

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!  Solid performing grinder
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, been using it for a week. Very consistent grinds. I had been using a $50-$60 burr grinder for a couple of years and decided to give this one a try and have been very pleased with the performance. PROS: Very consistent grids, Spot on cup measurement with built in scale, not too loud, slender design doesn't take up too much counter space, not as much static build up. CONS: more that I wanted to spend for a grinder, but no regrets on this purchase. If you need a good video review of this product, check this link out:
customer_reviews.author: SirSaint

customer_reviews.title: Good burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: I like this grinder it is my second one in 3 years. Produces a lot of static electricity that gets ground everywhere
customer_reviews.author: kerryjack

customer_reviews.title: Worth every single cent
customer_reviews.text: I've heard for years that a conical burr was better than a bladed grinder, but, after reading stories in the New York Times and hearing and NPR report, I finally decided to just order one. It's awesome!!! It's way better than I expected. I swear to you, your coffee will taste different - it'll actually taste much stronger, which I like.
customer_reviews.author: D.Landon.Felix

customer_reviews.title: The best, most consistent grind for all the machines I ...
customer_reviews.text: The best, most consistent grind for all the machines I have used over the years has been on this machine. Been using for a few months now. No issues to date. My only small gripe is the hulls flake off and static causes them to float outside the catch canister and stick on the machine. A little messy at times. Really good quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Consistent and quiet for french press
customer_reviews.text: Nice jump in consistency from the Capresso grinder I had been using. I only do French press and I love it for that. The load cell makes it easy to get repeatable results, not that a measuring spoon won't work. The unit is quiet and I don't seem to get that annoying build up of grounds that have to be tapped into the container before I pull it.
customer_reviews.author: xdsshooter

customer_reviews.title: Before every morning we would measure out the beans on a scale and then grind it - having a one touch grinder than sets how much
customer_reviews.text: If you are serious about coffee you NEED this grinder. Before every morning we would measure out the beans on a scale and then grind it - having a one touch grinder than sets how much coffee its grinding is GREAT and it works so much faster than our other burr grinder. It's pricey but worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Cherryville Photography

customer_reviews.title: hard to get setup and to maintain setttings
customer_reviews.text: took 2 exchange's 3-5 calls to support now works most of the time
customer_reviews.author: J FINK

customer_reviews.title: OXO Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: The product performed as advertised. It is working great. It produces a much better and consistent coffee grind than my previous burr grinder.
customer_reviews.author: SG1

customer_reviews.title: makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: the static electricity generated during the grinding process is so great the grinds literally jump out of the receiving vessel. They cling to the surface of the machine as well as fling out over a foot away. This occurs in such quantity that it is absurd and not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AFTER ONE YEAR ITS DEAD
customer_reviews.text: I wish this would be a good review, but alas i have nothing but bad news to discuss when thinking about my Oxo coffee grinder. It has been lame and limping along the morning bean trail for the last 4 months and now its just dead. I would highly recommend getting a different brand. I want to have good coffee every morning this one will not allow me, boo hoo!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 3 months now and I absolutely love it. My previous grinder had ceramic discs, which tended to extract or "mash" out some of the oils in the beans I think; the repository catching the beans was constantly coated with this and difficult to clean. I find this grinder produces grounds with none of this effect at all, which I assume is what makes the coffee taste so much richer, because I noticed the difference in taste immediately. I also love that it measures the amount of coffee being ground by weight, so I have a perfect amount ground every time.
customer_reviews.author: David Boudle

customer_reviews.title: Pefect Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Love that it has a scale, and it grinds quickly and quietly. Has very low energy use. Doesn't spray the ground coffee outside the grinder. It's just perfect in all aspects.
customer_reviews.author: firtree

customer_reviews.title: this is the best coffee grinder ever
customer_reviews.text: Without any question. this is the best coffee grinder ever. Not only is the price right, it performs admirably. I absolutely endorse this product and recommend it without hesitation. It is quiet and not messy, and does just what it is supposed to. I really can't say enough good things about it.
customer_reviews.author: Duffy

customer_reviews.title: ... for a bit over a week now and I love it. The bring is very good with no ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this grinder for a bit over a week now and I love it. The bring is very good with no "powder". I have used it for espresso, french press and drip makers. I roast coffee so I have been able to address how easy it is to fill and change beans in the hopper. I love the integrated scale and have had no issues with cleaning it. The disassembly is easy and allows for thorough cleaning. This is a fantastic upgrade for those of you not willing to commit to the $300+ grinders. Time will tell about the quality, but out of the box it is doing a fantastic job!
customer_reviews.author: Moskals

customer_reviews.title: Foam tape to save the day!
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this item because of the built in scale. Like everyone else I was concerned regarding the grinds flying around. So I bought some foam tape to raise the level of the cannister, so at least that issue is addressed. But to be honest for almost $200 I’m not sure why this is even designed the way it is.
customer_reviews.author: Prince Carandang

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dollar
customer_reviews.text: As long as you avoid french roast beans this is an amazing grinder. I love the digital built in scale. Easy to adjust grind settings and coffee strength. Looks great on the countertop. I was hesitant to spend this much on a grinder however the cost is justified by having a consistent amazing cup of coffee when I choose.
customer_reviews.author: TAB

customer_reviews.title: Kind of fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job of grinding instead of cutting the coffee beans. Like the way you can store whole coffee beans in it. Love the dial for number of cups you want to grind. It does jam once the bean count gets too low, but easily remedied by shaking it!
customer_reviews.author: Stella D'Orion

customer_reviews.title: Grinds go everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate honest reviews when buying products. This grinder isn't contained and the grounds go everywhere. Not worth the price or daily mess
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Small

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, the best coffee grinder I've ever owned. Beans are at a perfect grind. Very easy to clean. Love the scale option for measuring. It even grinds oily beans to perfection. The cup has a little static but not like any of the burr grinders we've had or seen at a friends. Seriously, this is a great product. Not cheaply built.
customer_reviews.author: #GoHawks

customer_reviews.title: Makes a huge mess!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes a terrible mess every time its used. Coffee grinds literally cover a 2'x2' area of my countertop, and the matching (outside) is covered in coffee grinds. This is due to a poor design of the chute to canister connection. I shouldn't have to endure the mess to get a decent grind.
customer_reviews.author: Anson Simque

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this grinder unless you enjoy cleaning up chaffe everytime you use it to grind beans. Horribly designed with a gap between the funnel and container. Makes an absolute mess every time.
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: The best coffee burr grinder I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This product is a must a very easy to use and an essential for the use of making the perfect grind for whatever coffee you need. Wether it be a pour over coffee or espresso. This works wonders with my Chemex!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love the built in scale! Removes guesswork and having to use a scoop!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: No Lemon With My Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder a little over a year ago. I might be able to find the purchase on credit card purchases, but I did not keep the receipt. I like the accuracy, but the piece that keeps the burrs together has little pins that shifted and a plastic retainer was destroyed. I had never paid this much for a grinder and I am sorely let down. I love the OXO Coffee maker, but the grinder is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery T.

customer_reviews.title: Definite recommend
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than expected after reading all the reviews. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Griffindork

customer_reviews.title: Nice grinder, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Nice grind, easy to clean. The bottom container does not connect to the top grinder but doesn't make much of a mess. A little high pitched but nice grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's easy and excellent.
customer_reviews.text: The fact that it weighs the coffee beans for a cup or two is marvelous; the grind is perfectr.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Paprin

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. Quick and easy enough to use even on busy mornings. Wide range of grind options and very even grind. Had it about a month and I use it every day. Haven't used the scale yet but it's I'm sure I will eventually.
customer_reviews.author: kk

customer_reviews.title: Quality grinder...
customer_reviews.text: The OXO conical grinder is a high quality grinder for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Doug  Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Filthy mess every time
customer_reviews.text: Makes a mess when it grinds coffee. Leaves grounds all over the counter. Static causes coffee to stick to the outside of machine. I do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Machine Grinds to a Stop
customer_reviews.text: Purchased item in July 2016 . In a household where only two people drink coffee in the morning mainly the machine completely died within six months. Its unfortunate because while worked it was the best coffee grinder I have had. It measured exact amounts of coffee as it grinded it . Coffee came out tasting exactly the same each time it was brewed.
customer_reviews.author: Art D.

customer_reviews.title: but the digital dosing scale is super cool and works well with my Clever Coffee Dripper
customer_reviews.text: Louder and faster RPM than I would prefer, but the digital dosing scale is super cool and works well with my Clever Coffee Dripper.
customer_reviews.author: Dooser

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this grinder
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this grinder!!! We make expresso & coffee grounds. Have made well over 80 lbs. of coffee and still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Loved the grinder
customer_reviews.text: Loved the grinder, Works well. Love how I can dial in the exa ct gram of coffee beans without having to use my own scale. Saves one step and saves time.
customer_reviews.author: Vic M.

customer_reviews.title: One Part of a Duo to Make Outstanding Coffee
customer_reviews.text: We bought the burr grinder in combination with the OXO twelve cup barista brain coffee maker. The combination together makes excellent, fine restaurant grade coffee. The grinder itself, despite the many adjustments available to fine tune the grind and hence flavor of a particular bag of beans, is very simple to use and the results are outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it mainly for grinding espresso beans and it does a great job! and it looks nice too. Now I don't have to stand in line to use the crappy grinders at Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: it was great. However
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than 4 months ago and at first, it was great. However, now when I grind the beans, it makes a mess on my counter top every time I grind the beans. I know it can happen with old beans, so I made sure to use fresh beans and it still happens.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J.

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new grinder!!! It is smart and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I tried a Kitchen-Aid grinder, it was less than acceptable. However this OXO grinder is to die for.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C Stahlhut

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, loud
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy to use but could be quieter I guess
customer_reviews.author: Louis Morda

customer_reviews.title: It is not noisy for a grinder
customer_reviews.text: Love, Love, Love.....shopped all over, can grind by using # of cups or by gms. Best Conical burr grinder made. simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: mixed results
customer_reviews.text: When it works I would give it five stars, when it doesn't I want to throw it out the window. This thing is just too tempermental when you try to set it for certain cups. You have to constantly check the hopper, etc. The manual shows you how to correct it, though material in the manual is poorly organized.
customer_reviews.author: Rue Morgue

customer_reviews.title: Up your coffee game at home
customer_reviews.text: Coffee tastes twice as good once I got this. The ability to choose both the grind size and strength makes it amazing. Worth the price if you want to up your coffee game at home.
customer_reviews.author: Robei wan

customer_reviews.title: The grind is great. I only do espresso so I don't use ...
customer_reviews.text: The grind is great. I only do espresso so I don't use the scale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hopper feed unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Coffee beans do not feed smoothly into grinder hopper intake. Constant manual manipulation of the beans in the hopper is required in order to ensure grind doesn't stall out. Other than that grinder produces repeatable product output.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for drip coffee
customer_reviews.text: After using this grinder for over a year, I would say it does a great job for drip coffee. If you're grinding for espresso, it will not grind fine enough. The built in scale is a nice add as well as the removeable hopper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has done a great job so far
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for a little over a month, two mornings a week. Has done a great job so far.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Upton

customer_reviews.title: get a bodum.
customer_reviews.text: static and grinds everywhere with this thing. why couldn't they just make the receptacle glass?
customer_reviews.author: 대니

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful grinder. I love how it weights the coffee ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful grinder. I love how it weights the coffee grounds. It makes brewing coffee so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Does not leave a mess like some grinders ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Does not leave a mess like some grinders because the top stays on when you dump the grounds. Holds over a 1lb bag of beans. Works great with the OXO coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love how it works. Enjoying it every day. No issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Down by the River

customer_reviews.title: User friendliness sacrificed for complexity
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder is far more sophisticated than it needs to be. The idea of having a scale is good, but not necessary. Instructions are not easy to understand. But, the most undesirable part of the design of the grinder is that there is a gap between the ground coffee chute and the ground coffee container, which allows the static charged grounds to scatter all around the grinder - not a good thing. The conical burr grinders also have a tendency to clog when the more oily French roast beans are ground.
customer_reviews.author: Rich D.

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This coffee grinder is very disapointing for a company that makes inovative and quality products. It jams up with beans and when grinding there is a small amount of coffee grinds on the counter. Returned it and bought a Moccamaster no jaming and no grinds outside of the container.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and it worked great! Spendy, But most good stuff is.
customer_reviews.author: Crypt Keeper

customer_reviews.title: Really good grinder. Uniform grounds
customer_reviews.text: Really good grinder. Uniform grounds. Scale is pretty close to accurate too usually within a half gram to gram. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: The first pot of coffee was great, but the next day the grinder jammed half ...
customer_reviews.text: The first pot of coffee was great, but the next day the grinder jammed half way through the cycle. I took it apart and cleaned it three times according to the directions (which is tricky and messy) but I never could get it to run without jamming. Maybe I got a lemon, but I'm not going to risk all that aggravation again so I returned it. The return process was painless, so I'm grateful for that.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Bourdette

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Design with one Fault  "IT DOESN'T GROUND COFFEE"
customer_reviews.text: We have a OXO coffee makes and we love it. Sadly cant say the same for this one. It doesn't even work. Followed all the instruction and filled the hopper with coffee. it started then gave the error saying there are no beans. tried several times and kept giving the same error. Very disappointed. May be we got a defected one. But after looking at the reviews I am not the only person who had the same issue. Hopefully I will be able to return this and get a refund. Big thumbs down for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Anya

customer_reviews.title: Make exactly the type of coffee you want by grinding exactly the amount you want ground...fresh and to the exact grind you like
customer_reviews.text: simple to use, easy to clean, lots of grinding levels. the container holds a good grind amount for doing a big 12 cup pot that you want extra strong. get it, you will use it a lot
customer_reviews.author: Insatiable illiterate

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, never got the grinder to work. Move on and buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about 5 seconds
customer_reviews.text: Got the unit today, set it up, poured in some beans and hit grind. Ground 3 grams of beans (set for 55) and stopped working. Would not work again, even after emptying the hopper, tapping out the beans that were in there and refilling. Shame as Oxo usually makes good things, but not this product. I can not recommend this grinder to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I hope I can return this and get a product that works better. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Just is not worth the money their asking !! Coffee grounds everywhere from the shooter. Constantly clogged in the hopper . I hope I can return this and get a product that works better. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BN

customer_reviews.title: Pure garbage, this is the second item I have that ...
customer_reviews.text: Pure garbage, this is the second item I have that is made by this company. Quality of there products are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: R.  Bondy

customer_reviews.title: For a $200 Grinder - it is pretty bad.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I thought this would be awesome - but it really isn't. The biggest problem is that if you have to use both decaf and caf, you are out of luck because the back bean container only holds one kind of bean. Also, if you make more grind than you can use, the cub that holds it does not have a sealable lid! There is a big gaping hole in the top of it. We have to get a sandwich bag and cover it. For $200 a pop, you would expect this thing to be much better designed. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Ricard

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to my coffee routine
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee grinder! I recently bought a Chemex and wanted to be able to control the grind. I experimented with various grind settings on this grinder until I found the one I like. After dialing the number of cups of coffee I want, I just press the button and wait for it to finish. Then I take the container of ground beans, unscrew the lid, and pour the contents in my filter. Couldn't be easier. I don't bother with a brush, and I don't worry about tiny coffee dust sticking to the plastic container. It is minimal and tomorrow that container will have ground coffee in it, so what's to clean!
customer_reviews.author: T. Ray Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Pricy, but a great grinder
customer_reviews.text: I'm an avid coffee drinker, and I make several smaller servings per day. I waited to right this review for almost a year, as I've had problems with durability and function over time with other brands. This coffee grinder and maker makes an outstanding coffee. I've used it daily for eight months now without a problem. The variable settings for the grind, the volume (by weight or cups), limited maintenance and functionality is the best I've experienced. I'm not sure if the value is worth the price, but if it's a great system. If the system is still working well next year at this time, I'll be pleased to have spent $500 on a brewing system.
customer_reviews.author: HDLikeMe

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy With This Purchase
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I dislike about this machine. It is fast, and accurate and simple to operate, and given the crazy prices of competing grinders with scales, it is a bargain. I use it with a single cup drip brewer. Because of this, it is best to measure by weight not by volume to have consistency and control in the brew while exploring the flavor of different bean varieties. Its fun to play, "Use 16 grams for these beans at this grind setting, but use 20 grams for these beans at this setting." I have not had any problems with large amounts of grinds flying out all over the counter top.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Faull

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Coffee Grinder - Really Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The OXO grinder is a pleasure to use. It can be easily adjusted for a range of brews and brewing techniques. It's easy to use - just fill the bean hopper, choose your grind, dial in the amount of coffee you want and then - moment of drama! - press the button and watch it work. The grind is consistent - the output is not full of big pieces and dust, rather it's just what you chose it to be. I use this grinder every morning. It's the best grinder I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I got this for our wedding and we love having the fresh ground beans for our coffee every morning. When we got pregnant, we bought an extra hopper for it so she could have decaf while I continued drinking regular. It does give a reliable and consistent grind every time and has a wide range of settings to really dial in the grind you like. I found that the scale had to be re-calibrated a lot more often than I would have expected. Also, the plastic cup the grinds fall into is prone to static. I replaced it with a small, wide-mouth mason jar which works really well with no static problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tim F.

customer_reviews.title: Pro Tip: grind into a filter.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super-nice, easy to use, FAST, like everyone says. An easy way to make it even better is to grind directly into your coffee filter (use a simple pour-over holder like this). Place that with your filter under the grinder, zero it with the tare feature (once). After grinding you can place the loaded filter in your coffeemaker, no messy pouring of grinds or dealing with static.
customer_reviews.author: John Smallberries

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years and 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in November of 2017. Used it just about once a day, every day. On March 29th, 2020, it died. It worked great for the time I had it. I just expect at a price point like this I would get at least 5+ years of service from the appliance.
customer_reviews.author: J. Masteller

customer_reviews.title: Good, not excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is a good grinder. It produces a nice, even grind. The use of a scale to determine the exact amount of coffee ground is really nice. There are two downsides: 1. It is inconvenient for an espresso basket. You cannot grind directly into the basket, and the container does not pour easily into a small container. 2. The beans stop feeding into the grinder especially when the bean container is full. Although you can loosen the beans by shaking the grinder, it is a nuisance to do especially with the scale.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beckwith

customer_reviews.title: OXO is an excellent company
customer_reviews.text: Best, most convenient coffee grinder I have found to date. It actually weighs the coffee. No having to guess with a timed grinder. It holds a lot of coffee. The burr grinding apparatus is, by far, superior to any other grinder I have used. That includes built in grinders as well as stand alone grinders. The Oxo employees are friendly, helpful, polite. Seem truly concerned with me. The bean holder detaches. I bought 5 extra holders and I can keep 5 different kinds of coffee ready for use. I also own Oxo's Barista Brain 12 cup coffee maker. I am pleased with it as well. These items are designed to look like a set. Very impressive on the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Pallid Un

customer_reviews.title: Love it easy , but to much static
customer_reviews.text: Love it easy to use pour your beans and get the amount you want . The only thing I would say it creates a lot of static , their are coffee grinds inside the funnel and outside of the machine too . I read the other reviews and i read that one was a problems , I also bought a glass beaker to help with this issue . The container it comes with is not ideal .
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Ivan Ojeda

customer_reviews.title: Started Out Nice
customer_reviews.text: Started out with a nice, even grind and the scale was a convenient feature. After about 6 months the scale wouldn’t tare properly anymore and have to put a small amount of weight on there in order to set a grind weight or it just keeps resetting to “-“. About a year after use and the grind is pretty terrible. I get everything from a fine dust to 1/8” chunks all on the same grind setting. I’m becoming pretty exasperated trying to find a good grinder that lasts. It seems that they don’t exist.
customer_reviews.author: B. Haney

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Best burr grinder out there for under $200. Pros: Accurate and easy measuring and grinding. Easy to clean. Cons: Same as them all. Static electricity can hinder getting the grinds out of the plastic cup. Also, love the colored bean and grinds holder to keep the beans protected. BTW: ive had two previous grinders and this grinder has outlasted them all.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great product with great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my grinder for well over a year. Continues to work as quickly and consistently as the day I opened the box. Until this morning. We had a power surge/electricity out for a few seconds last night that apparently messed with the circuitry. I called customer service and they walked me through a reboot. Presto! Good as new! Great product with great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Loved it... for 4 years!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect tool for those who like consistent measurements and outcome in their coffee making efforts. The ability to dial up or down the amount, when your trying a new coffee, is priceless! So much control. Thank you, OXO! EDIT: After 4 years of satisfactory service... the dial finally stopped working! (Not bad, for any electronic appliance.) I returned to Amazon, to order another... but the unit price climbed unacceptably higher. So, I ordered the similar Krups unit, for under half the cost of a new OXO. I love OXO brands... however...
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: The second one performed like the first
customer_reviews.text: This grinder has all the features I looked for, but, after grinding once, it clogged and I had to take it apart and clean it. Next time, it didn't work at all so I exchanged it for another one. The second one performed like the first, so, I returned it also. I could easily recommend this grinder for all the features, but, if you want to grind coffee, try something else. Sorry, OXO--stick to potato peelers.
customer_reviews.author: geezer

customer_reviews.title: Super messy
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is not for someone who prefers clean countertops and floors. Unfortunately, the receptacle that catches the ground beans is not completely enclosed so the air and grinding action of the machine creates static which throws the grounds in lots of different places. I was fed up with cleaning part of the kitchen just to have a cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Connor

customer_reviews.title: Complete lemon
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package unable to grind beans. Gave it a thorough cleaning. Still overheated almost immediately and produced no grounds. Extremely shoddy product and bad first experience with OXO. Will not be giving them a second chance.
customer_reviews.author: B.R.

product_meta.title: OXO BREW Conical Burr Coffee Grinder with Integrated Scale,Silver,Burr Grinder
product_meta.description:
Size:Burr GrinderA truly perfect brew starts with ground coffee, but it takes the right grinder to help coffee beans unlock their full flavor potential. The OXO On Conical Burr Coffee Grinder’s intelligent, built-in scale precisely measures coffee as you grind. Choose from 3 grinding modes: cup mode using pre-set ratio of 8 grams per cup, grams mode to grind the exact amount of grams you like, or manual mode to grind by time. The Grinder's high torque/low-speed DC motor helps keep beans from overheating while grinding; the conical burrs create a consistent and uniform grind for optimal flavor extraction. Whether you like strong or mild, espresso or drip, French Press or pour-over, the OXO Conical Burr Coffee Grinder helps you get the grounds you need to make your perfect cup.

It's easy to tare the scale to get a precise read or if you'd like to use a different container for grinding. Here's how you do it:

Press and hold the OXO button, until the ring around the button blinks and the menu mode appears (keep holding!). The button light will turn red and there will be a three-second countdown on the display; keep pressing the button until you reach "0". That's it! You're ready to grind! 

NOTE: PRODUCT IS ONLY COMPATIBLE WITH 110V OUTLETS



BRAND STORY
By OXO
feature_bullets: OXO On Conical Burr Grinder built-in scale measures grounds by weight instead of time, eliminating the need for a separate scale; automatic shutoff ensures a precise amount of ground coffee every time
Durable, 40 mm stainless steel conical burrs create uniform grounds for up to 38 settings -- from fine for espresso to coarse for French press or cold brew
High torque/low speed motor won’t overheat beans, preserving flavor and generating minimal static for less mess. Built-in overheating detection protects motor for long life
Use the single dial to switch between Cups Mode, Grams Mode or Manual Mode. In Cups mode, you grind based on the number of cups of coffee you would like to brew.
No-bean detector won't let you grind if the hopper is empty.Voltage is 120V/60Hz
Hopper holds 16 oz of coffee beans and features a "trap door" to hold beans in when hopper is removed. Grounds keeper holds up to 125 grams -- enough ground coffee to brew 12 cups

The OXO Better Guarantee: If you experience an issue with your OXO product, get in touch with us to repair or replace it. We’re grateful for the opportunity to learn from your experience, and we’ll make it better

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
